intro: Eriocephalus tuberculosus, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, spherical seed heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance. Eriocephalus tuberculosus is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
